title: Park Unable to Receive Phone Messages
description: At this time, phone messages cannot be left at the visitor center. Please email the park at moca_tuzi_info@nps.gov or call during operating hours if you need to contact the park.

title: Ongoing: Partial Closure of Lawn Adjacent to Liberty Bell Center
description: The southeast portion of the lawn adjacent to the Liberty Bell Center closed for a construction project beginning Monday, August 19. Liberty Bell Center operations are not impacted and the exterior viewing window remains accessible.

title: Beginning December 4, 2024: Signers Garden is Closed
description: Signers Garden at 5th and Chestnut Streets is closed for a construction project.

title: Water Fountains and Select Restrooms- Closed for Season
description: The water fountain at the Picnic Area and Memorial Area have been closed for winter. Picnic Area Restrooms and Beach Restroom have been closed for winter. They will reopen in Spring 2025.

title: West Auto Tour Closed
description: The West Auto Tour is closed for the season.

title: Winter Hours Notice
description: The park visitor center and historic fort are closed until April 2025. Trails remain open from sunrise to sunset during this time and can be toured via cell phone and the NPS app. Free classroom visits by a ranger can be booked by calling 315-336-4448.

title: Ice Caves Status: Closed
description: The ice caves near Meyers Beach within the National Lakeshore are currently inaccessible due to non-existent or unstable ice conditions. The last time conditions allowed access to the ice caves was 2015.

title: Wheelchair Lift Out of Service
description: The lift at the FDR Home is currently out of service. We are working to correct this as soon as possible. We apologize for any inconvenience.

title: Ongoing Closure Notices
description: Devils Island dock and campsites, West Bay Club on Sand Island, and the trail on Stockton Island between Presque Isle Bay and Quarry Bay are closed. These closures affect only a small portion of the Lakeshore. Enjoy your visit.

title: Closure on Joyce Road NW for bridge replacement
description: Joyce Road NW is closed from the entrance of Rock Creek Park Golf Course to Missouri Ave NW while the bridge over Luzon Branch is replaced. Detours will be in place during the closure period.

title: Winter Road Closures
description: Sand Point Road is the only road maintained by the park in the winter. All other park roads, including Miners Castle Road and Chapel Road are not plowed within the park boundary.

title: Driving Closure: Bellport Beach to Long Cove
description: Due to sections of narrow beach, the area west of Bellport Beach to Long Cove is closed to driving until further notice to prevent further erosion and damage to ocean-facing dunes.

title: Tioga Road (Highway 120 through the park) and Glacier Point Road are closed for the winter
description: Tioga Road (continuation of Highway 120 through the park) and Glacier Point Road are closed for the season due to snow. They usually open around late May or June. Call 209/372-0200 (then 1, 1) for road conditions and tire chain requirements.

title: Water Fountain/Bottle Filling Station Shut Off
description: The water fountains and bottle filling station at the restroom area across from the barn have been shut off for the winter. Toilets still function. Please plan ahead and bring enough water for hiking. Water is available in the visitor center when open.

title: State Route 148 closed for the winter season
description: Visitors can access the park via Highway 143 and the town of Brian Head. You can view Cedar Breaks from the North View Overlook. State Route 143 will remain open, weather permitting.

title: Fire Restrictions Lifted, in place Moderate Fire Danger, Beginning November 25
description: Wood and charcoal fires permitted. Please monitor this website and the park social media pages for the most up to date information as conditions can change rapidly.

title: Jamestown Island Loop Drive Closed for Bridge Rehabilitation Project
description: Colonial National Historical Park will implement a temporary closure of the Jamestown Island Loop Drive beginning on Monday December 2, 2024 to safely rehabilitate three wooden bridges on the drive.

title: Occasional Phone and Internet Issues
description: We are still experiencing occasional ongoing internet and phone outages beyond our control. We remain open and can usually receive calls and email but there may be some delays. If you are trying to reach us, please call 925-812-6164.

title: Trail Closure at Quartermaster Depot Area
description: Due to recent heavy rains, there is a partial closure of the trail system around the Quartermaster Depot until hazard mitigation has been completed for the ruins. When visiting, please stay on the trail, away from ruin walls and obey warnings / closures.

title: Partial Closure due to Carr Fire
description: While most of the park has reopened after the 2018 Carr Fire, some areas are still closed for safety. Please exercise caution when hiking in areas affected by the Carr Fire.

title: Island Closed from November 1 through April 15 Annually
description: From November 1 - April 15 annually, Isle Royale and its surrounding islands are closed to all visitors. Lake Superior waters are open to boaters. All islands reopen April 16. Call (906) 482-0984 to discuss trip planning, obtain permits, or pay fees.

title: Visitor Centers are Closed for the Season
description: All park visitor centers have closed for the season. This includes the Houghton, Rock Harbor, & Windigo Visitor Centers. For trip planning assistance, contact the park at (906) 482-0984.

title: Oversized Vehicles are Unable to Park in Visitor Center Parking Lot
description: Due to construction, oversized vehicles will not be allowed to park in the visitor center parking lot due to lack of space and ability to turn-around safely. There is oversized parking along the main park road.

title: Campground Open with Limited Services
description: The campground is open for winter camping. The water is shut off for the season and campers must plan accordingly. Comfort stations are closed and inaccessible. Vault toilets remain available. Campers must walk, bike, or snowshoe in to access campground.

title: Caves are Closed
description: Due to snow, Indian Tunnel and Dewdrop Cave are CLOSED.

title: Landslide at Colville Flats on Friday, November 17, 2024
description: Landslide caused a large displacement wave on Lake Roosevelt. Water washed over HWY 25 north of Colville Flats. This led to an increase in debris in the lake that will float downstream in the coming days. The land is still moving and unstable. Use caution

title: Visitor Center Construction May Impact Visitor Experience
description: A new visitor center is currently under construction and may impact park visitors. Visit the link below for the most up to date information.

title: Staff Unable to Check Phone Messages
description: At this time, staff are unable to check phone messages left at the visitor center. Please email the park at moca_tuzi_info@nps.gov if you need to contact the park.

title: State Route 20 Closed for the Season
description: State Route 20 is closed at milepost 134 (Ross Dam Trailhead) for the season due to heavy snowfall and risk of avalanche danger. Check the WSDOT real time map for up-to-date information, https://wsdot.com/Travel/Real-time/Map/.

title: Beat the Heat
description: Make sure to take hot weather into consideration. Carry water and use sunscreen to reduce the risk of heat injuries during your visit.

title: Rip Currents and Rough Surf
description: Remember that rough surf is dangerous & rip currents can be deadly. Please use caution when swimming at Canaveral National Seashore.

title: North Rim Road and East Portal Road closed for winter
description: North Rim Road and East Portal Road are closed. Both will reopen in spring as conditions permit. East Portal Road reopening is determined by the Bureau of Reclamation.

title: South Rim Drive closed for winter
description: South Rim Drive is closed past the South Rim Visitor Center. Until there is enough snow for grooming, it will remain open for pedestrians and bicycles.

title: Steel Creek Ranger Station Phones Offline
description: Phones are currently down at Steel Creek Ranger Station due to widespread flooding. For park information, please call Tyler Bend Visitor Center at 870-439-2502.

title: Backcountry Trail Conditions
description: GPS is necessary on backcountry trails: Oakridge, River, and Kingsnake. These trails may be difficult to follow. River Trail is not recommended at this time due to the volume of downed trees and debris from recent storms.

title: Charles Pinckney House Closed for the Season
description: The Charles Pinckney House is closed for the season. The site grounds will remain open from 9 AM -- 5 PM, Wednesday -- Sunday.

title: Old East Entrance Station Parking Area Closure
description: The Old East Entrance Station parking area will be closed to visitor traffic for the winter. Coal Vein Road will be the temporary visitor/vehicle turn-around area.

title: Section of the boardwalk is closed
description: Due to safety concerns the section of the boardwalk closest to the cave is closed. The staff are working on a plan to address the situation.

title: Backcountry vehicle route closed for the season
description: The backcountry vehicle route has closed for the season until May 15, 2025. As conditions allow, the route will be maintained as a groomed ski and snowshoe trail from the Cabin District to the horse barn near Cerro Piñon.

title: Flooding/bridge out on the Grand Portage Trail at Poplar Creek
description: Increased rain and beaver dam activity flooded the Poplar Creek Crossing along the Grand Portage Trail, washing out the bridge. Please use caution as you pass. Park staff is in the process of determining a route less prone to flood damage.

title: North Entrance Road and Rim Drive are CLOSED for the season.
description: The North Entrance Road and East & West Rim Drives are now closed for the season a few The roads will not open again until mid to late June or July 2025. All other roads are open.

title: Holiday Hours
description: On Thanksgiving Day, Christmas Eve, Christmas Day, and New Year's Day the visitor center will be closed (trails will remain open with access to restrooms on the north side of the building).

title: Cashless Fee Collection Exercise
description: Fort Davis National Historic Site to begin 6-month cashless fee collection exercise starting Monday November 18, 2024. Transition to electronic payments reduces transaction times, saves money, and improves accountability.

title: Please Email if Unable to Reach by Phone
description: Park phones are experiencing technical issues at this time. If unable to reach by phone, please feel free to email cong_information@nps.gov with any questions.

title: Potential delays during stone wall rehabilitation project
description: The stone wall that lines Skyline Drive is being rehabilitated between miles 72.8 and 75.7. There will be a single lane closure for the duration of this work, with an established work zone that will be managed by flaggers. Visitors should expect delays.

title: Adams Memorial temporarily not on view.
description: A protective structure currently covers this outdoor sculpture as preservation efforts proceed in the surrounding landscape. The Shaw/54th Regiment Memorial, Farragut Memorial, and Standing Lincoln are on view during daylight hours.

title: Highway 180 Access To Cedar Grove Area of Kings Canyon National Park Closed For the Season
description: Highway 180 is closed east of Hume Lake Road for the winter season. Cedar Grove is not accessible. This section of road typically reopens in late April.

title: Bumpass Hell Trail Closed For Season
description: 11/12/2024 - Due to recent snowfall, the Bumpass Hell Trail has closed for the season. This is an annual closure to prevent injury from treacherous trail conditions near hydrothermal areas.

title: No Gasoline is Available in the Park
description: The gas pumps at Mazama Village are CLOSED for the season. Please plan ahead and fill up your tank before heading to the park.

title: Service Road Closure
description: The walkway toward the lighthouse is closed to due construction of the roadway. Please do not enter the area.

title: Fishing Creek Bridge Closed - May Cause Delay
description: The Fishing Creek Bridge will be closed on Monday, November 11, 2024, until further notice. All visitors will need to take the alternate route on the Cumberland Parkway at Exit 78 and head east on KY-Highway 80 towards Nancy.

title: Part of Fort Totten Park remains closed for public safety
description: Out of an abundance of caution, Fort Totten Park will remain closed east of Fort Totten Drive, south of Gallatin Street/Metropolitan Branch Trail and north of Brookland Ave NE/Farragut St. due to the investigation involving two WWI-era munitions found.

title: Part of Fort Totten Park remains closed for public safety
description: Out of an abundance of caution, Fort Totten Park will remain closed east of Fort Totten Drive, south of Gallatin Street/Metropolitan Branch Trail and north of Brookland Ave NE/Farragut St. due to the investigation involving two WWI-era munitions found.

title: Visitor Center Closed on Mondays and Tuesdays in Winter Months
description: Beginning November 18, 2024 through March 31, 2025 the visitor center and bookstore will be closed on Mondays and Tuesdays, but the historic ranch buildings will remain open seven days a week with normal winter hours of 9:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.

title: Temporary Nighttime Road Closures for Deer Management
description: From November 1, 2024 to March 31, 2025, the NPS may temporarily close select park roads between 5 p.m. to 4 a.m. to conduct deer management operations. Per the Rock Creek Park Superintendent’s Compendium, trails and other park areas close at sunset.

title: Fee Changes beginning in January 2025
description: Beginning January 1, 2025, the National Park Service (NPS) at Lake Roosevelt National Recreation Area will increase camping and boat launch fees and introduce a new dump station/water fill fee.

title: Monument Winter Season Operations
description: The African Burial Ground National Monument Outdoor Memorial has been winterized, with the water turned off for the winter season. The outdoor memorial will still be open Tuesday through Saturday from 10:00am until 4:00pm, weather permitting.

title: Wheeler Peak Scenic Drive Winter Closure
description: The Wheeler Peak Scenic Drive is closed at mile 3, Upper Lehman Creek Campground, for the winter season. For information on other closures, click more...

title: Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway continues with additional Parkway closures
description: Beginning Tuesday, April 9, 2024, construction will close the Colonial Parkway to all travel in either direction between Yorktown and VA Route 199. Follow all detour signs. See additional closure information in the link below.

title: Cascade River Road Seasonal Closure
description: Cascade River Road is closed for the season at Eldorado (milepost 20). Check the road conditions page for more information.

title: New Mexico Road Advisories
description: The New Mexico Department of Transportation updates its map of road advisories regularly. Visitors are encouraged to look for any possible road advisories along their route of travel beforehand.

title: Park Hours may Change due to Winter Storms
description: Winter storms and ice may cause opening delays or temporary closures allowing plows to safely clear the roads. Before visiting, check this page daily for up-to-date information. Colorado Traction Law may apply, see info below. Click link for weather

title: Thaddeus Kosciuszko National Memorial Closed for the Season
description: Check back in Spring 2025 for a reopening date.

title: Kirby Storter - Partial Reopen
description: As of 11/4/2024, the Kirby Storter Boardwalk will reopen to the public. Note that the boardwalk is only open part of the way, as rebuilding has not yet begun.

title: Fall/Winter Hiking Safety
description: If you plan to hike the park trails be prepared with warm layers, proper footwear, traction devices, and trekking poles. Some areas on the trails can be snow-packed or icy and slippery. Weather can change quickly—plan ahead and be weather-ready.

title: Historic Homes Closed for Winter Season
description: The historic homes are closed for the winter season and unavailable for tours. The 2025 tour season is anticipated to begin late spring/early summer. The Visitor Center at 1250 Hancock St., Quincy, is open 11am-4pm Monday-Friday, except federal holidays.

title: Pierce Stocking Scenic Drive Winter & Spring Vehicle Road Closure
description: This road is closed to vehicles. It remains open to foot traffic. The seasonal reopening date is determined by the amount of sand, hazard trees, and debris that will need to be cleaned up or moved after winter storms. This is typically in mid-May.

title: Seasonal Hours Change
description: Monocacy National Battlefield is shifting to winter hours and the visitor center will be closed on Tuesdays and Wednesdays from November 5, 2024, to May 1, 2025. The grounds remain open on those days for your enjoyment unless otherwise stated.

title: Baltimore Area Traffic Advisory
description: Traffic in the Baltimore area has increased considerably in recent months due to the collapse of the Francis Scott Key Bridge which connected the Baltimore beltway. Please check the latest traffic conditions to plan your travel accordingly.

title: Sat & Sun IF parking is full, entrance closes, no entrance until parking available.
description: Saturdays & Sundays with good weather, IF our parking lots fill we close the park entrance. (Georgetown Pike & Old Dominion Dr) We re-open when parking is available. No waiting, no street parking. Updates at Great Falls Park Facebook page.

title: Trail Ridge Road is Closed to Through Travel for the Season
description: Trail Ridge Road (U.S. Hwy 34) is closed to vehicles to through travel for the season. Trail Ridge Road is closed on the east side of the park at Many Parks Curve and on the west side of the park at Colorado River Trailhead.

title: Weir House, Weir Studio, Young Studio, Visitor Center, and Restrooms Closed
description: Please note starting November 1st all park buildings are closed for the season. Park grounds are open daily year-round and maps, brochures, and passport stamp are available in the parking lot kiosk. Restrooms are not available during the off-season.

title: Temporary Nighttime Road Closures for Deer Management
description: From November 1, 2024 to March 31, 2025, the NPS may temporarily close select park roads between 5 p.m. to 4 a.m. to conduct deer management operations. Per the Rock Creek Park Superintendent’s Compendium, trails and other park areas close at sunset.

title: Mineral King Road Is Closed For the Season
description: The portion of Mineral King Road inside Sequoia National Park is closed for the winter season to the general public. The road typically reopens in May on the Wednesday before Memorial Day, but could be later depending on conditions.

title: Trail Conditions
description: Rain may cause trails to be slick and overgrown. Staff and Volunteer Trail Crews clear trails regularly. Visitors should use caution and report trail issues to viis_interpretation@nps.gov

title: All lava tube caves closed November 1 through April 30
description: All park lava tube caves are closed for the winter from November 1 through April 30 to protect hibernating bats. This closure does not affect the Junction Bridge Cave at the start of El Calderon Trail.

title: Fritch Fortress Restroom Closure
description: Fritch Fortress Restrooms are closed until April 1, 2025 for the winter season.

title: Portion of Kekaulike Avenue in Kula to close for approximately nine months
description: A portion of Kekaulike Avenue (Route 377) between Waiakoa Road and ʻAlae Road will be closed for 24 hours, seven days a week, for approximately nine months.

title: Seasonal Closures
description: Park grounds are open during daylight hours, but park buildings are closed until Memorial Day weekend. Walkways, trails, and grounds are not currently maintained for public use and may be icy, snow-covered, or uneven. Restrooms are not available.

title: Baltimore Area Traffic Advisory
description: Traffic in the Baltimore area has increased considerably in recent months due to the collapse of the Francis Scott Key Bridge which connected the Baltimore beltway. Please check the latest traffic conditions to plan your travel accordingly.

title: Do Not Handle Wildlife
description: If you see a dead bat or a bat acting strangely at the fort, please do not touch or move it. Report the location of the animal to park staff.

title: Cunard Road closed from November 1 to about March 31, 2025
description: Improvements to Cunard Road will begin on Monday November 4, 2024 extending through winter to about March 31, 2025. The road will be completely closed during this time.

title: Seasonal Closures
description: Jumonville Glen, Mount Washington Tavern and the Picnic Area have closed for the season. They will reopen on May 1, 2025!

title: Moat Wall is closed for repairs until Fall 2026
description: The entire moat wall will be closed for repair and strengthening of the Fort Jefferson counterscarp (moat wall) damaged by Hurricane Irma in 2017 and Hurricane Ian in 2022. Additional damage occurred from hurricanes in 2024.

title: Wupatki Pueblo Partial Closure
description: 3 rooms at Wupatki pueblo are closed due to an unstable wall. The trail is fully open.

title: Possible Hazards in Open Sections
description: Parkway areas open after Hurricane Helene may have limited services. Visitors should exercise caution when hiking in or near open areas of the park. Hazards on trails such as landslides, tree debris, and washed-out sections or bridges are possible.(10/23)

title: Miners River Bridge Closed
description: The bridge connecting Miners Castle Road to Miners Beach is closed for a full bridge replacement. Closures will go through spring 2025.

title: Road to Exit Glacier Closed to Automobiles
description: The Alaska Department of Transportation has closed Herman Leirer Road for winter. Therefore, the road to Exit Glacier under the National Park Service is closed as well. Reopening is typically in mid to late-May, with variation due snow and weather.

title: Water in Campground is Shut Off for the Winter
description: Due to overnight freezing temperatures, water in the campground has been shut off for the season. Visitors should plan to bring their own water. Small containers may be filled at the visitor center during business hours.

title: Closed Tuesdays and Wednesdays effective Oct 20
description: Winter hours begin on October 20, 2024: the visitor center and park trails will be open five days a week, from Thursday through Monday. Closed on Tuesdays and Wednesdays. There is no trail access when the visitor center is closed.

title: Temporary Number Change
description: The park's phone number has temporarily changed. Please call 434-694-8904.

title: Site Access
description: Be aware in your planning that I-40 in NC and I-26 in TN have been compromised due to the effects of Hurricane Helene. In addition, the Erwin Hwy (107) bridge leading into Greeneville was destroyed and is not expected to reopen until sometime in 2025.

title: Help Prevent Aquatic Invasive Species (AIS) Infestation
description: A number of lakes are infested with an array of aquatic invasive species that damage natural ecosystems and waterways. Boaters are advised to Clean, Drain, and Dry all boats and equipment every time they leave the water.

title: No Water Available
description: Water systems throughout the park are shut off for the winter season. Plan ahead and bring all drinking water.

title: No Potable Water in Park Campgrounds
description: There currently is no water available in any campground in Great Basin National Park.  Water is available at the Lehman Caves Visitor Center, Great Basin Visitor Center, and local businesses.

title: All facilities are closed for the season
description: The newly constructed Visitor Contact Station, Zion Forever Park Store, and Human History Museum are closed for the winter season and will not reopen until snow conditions subside in the 2025 spring season.

title: Beware of Harmful Algal Blooms
description: Harmful Algal Blooms have been spotted on Lake Powell. If you suspect a harmful algal bloom, stay out of the water and avoid any contact with water or scums if you see pale-green or pea-green scum on or in the water. Read more at the link

title: Visitor Phone Line Intermittent
description: You may experience problems reaching park staff via the main visitor phone line which functions intermittently. You may email the park at lavo_information@nps.gov with general park questions.

title: White House Overlook and Trail to reopen in 2025
description: The White House Overlook and Trail are closed until next season. The Navajo Parks and Recreation staff will oversee this area seasonally with staff to open gates and answer questions. This area may require a fee in the future.

title: Maurice Stephens Parking Lot Closed During Construction Project
description: The parking lot near the Maurice Stephens house, located on Rt 23 opposite from the Washington Memorial Chapel, is closed during construction and renovation work on the house. Visitors are encouraged to park in the Chapel lot for Grand Parade trail access

title: Please Use Caution at the Truman Farm While Visiting---Preservation Work Underway
description: A special project to restore the foundation of the Truman Farm Home has begun. Construction has begun and will continue through December. Please be mindful of your surroundings. This work will ensure preservation of the structure for future generations.

title: Temporary Exhibit Closures:
description: The museum remains open as work progresses to redesign/refurbish exhibit spaces within. Click on the "more >" link below to see which exhibits are currently affected.

title: Due to flooding access points to Bluestone National Scenic River are closed
description: All access points to the park are currently closed. The road through Bluestone State Park and the Lilly access are currently closed due to flooding. Parts of the Bluestone Turnpike Trail may be flooded.

title: Phones Working Intermittently
description: As of 9/30/2024 our phone lines are working intermittently. If you are not able to reach us by phone, please email us at bela_information@nps.gov.

title: Box Canyon Day Use Area Closed
description: Due to the recent illegal lighting of a fire in the trash bin, the theft of government signs, and the unauthorized movement of barricades to drive into an area closed to vehicle traffic, the metal gate at the upper end of Box Canyon has now been closed.

title: Main Visitor Center Closed
description: Our main visitor center (VC) is closed due to ongoing construction, a temporary VC has been set up across the parking lot. The movie and museum are unavailable at this time, everything else is available inside the temporary VC.

title: Migrant Notice
description: Like elsewhere in the Florida Keys, we have seen an increase in Cuban migrants arriving by boat from Cuba and landing on the islands of Dry Tortugas National Park. You may observe migrant landings at the park and visitor areas may be impacted.

title: Expect Crowding
description: Parking lots and popular destinations are crowded especially on weekends and days with warm weather between 10 am and 3 pm.

title: Current East Rim Trail Status
description: Click "more" to find out if the East Rim trails are open today. In good conditions the trails are open 6 am-11 pm for bikers and as posted for other trail users. In wet or hazardous conditions, the trail will close to all users to prevent damage.

title: South Rim Road construction continuing in 2025
description: Major road improvement projects are complete for 2024. Construction will continue in 2025. Expect delays, alternating one-way traffic, and parking lot closures.

title: No Cell Service or WiFi
description: There is NO cell service or internet at Muir Woods. We discourage using a rideshare service to leave the woods. When hiring a taxi, visitors have the option of negotiating a flat rate or using the meter. Under some circumstances a flat rate may be cheaper

title: Fort Barrancas Closure
description: The Fort Barrancas Area to include the visitor center and the fort will be closed for the season until Spring of 2025.

title: Marconi Beach Stairs Closed
description: The Marconi Beach stairs are closed due to storm-caused erosion. There is no access to the beach from this location.

title: Technical Difficulties with Phones
description: Oregon Caves is experiencing technical difficulties with our phone system. For general park information, please call the Illinois Valley Visitor Center at 541-592-5125. Thank you for your patience.

title: Trail Closures Due to the Middle Fork Fire
description: The Bald Crater Loop, Bert Creek and Boundary Springs Trails are closed until further notice due to potentially hazardous conditions created by the Middle Fork Fire. The Pacific Crest Trail through the park is now completely open for hikers.

title: Bandelier's Shuttle Service has ended for the 2024 season.
description: Visitors may drive directly to the Bandelier Visitor Center, however, please be advised that parking may fill up and you may be turned around and asked to return later. Please call the Bandelier Visitor Center at (505) 672-3861 for more information.

title: Martin Van Buren NHS's Lindenwald and Visitor Center is closed for the season.
description: Lindenwald is closed for the season beginning November 3, 2024. Lindenwald and the visitor center will reopen for tours in late May 2025. Please check our calendar for further details. The site and trails remain open to the public but are not maintained.

title: Bottomland Nature Trail Will be Closed Starting September 3rd
description: The Bottomland Nature Trail will be closed beginning September 3rd for the trail resurfacing project. It will remain closed until work is complete. Fox Creek Trail remains open, but can only be accessed from the north through the under highway crossing.

title: Black Bears Frequenting the McAfee Knob Area in Virginia
description: Human-habituated bears have been frequently spotted in the McAfee Knob Area. Allowing bears access to human food or garbage causes it to lose its fear of humans. Follow all food storage regulations, use provided food lockers and never feed a bear.

title: Boardwalks at Watch Hill Partially Closed
description: Due to storm damage, partial closure of boardwalks at Watch Hill Nature Trail are in effect.

title: Adjustments to USS Cairo Museum and Visitor Center Days of Operation
description: Starting October 2, 2024, the USS Cairo Museum will be open 7 days a week and the Visitor Center will be open Wednesday-Sunday. The park grounds, fee booth, Visitor Center restrooms, and tour road will remain open seven days a week.

title: Partial Closure of Rocky Springs Trail
description: The Rocky Springs section is closed from the Rocky Springs campground at milepost 55 to the northern terminus at milepost 59 until further notice. Visitors should observe posted closures. The trail is unsafe due to trail erosion and deteriorated bridges.

title: Mount Locust Inn/Stand and Visitor Center Closed - Grounds Open Wednesday-Sunday
description: Due to storm damage, the visitor center is closed. The historic inn/stand is also closed due to serious structural concerns. The grounds are open Wednesday through Sunday, 9:00 AM to 3:30 PM. You can still view the stand but cannot enter.

title: Lasting Effects from 2021 Dixie Fire
description: Some facilities, infrastructure, and areas remain closed; please adhere to all closure signs. In re-opened areas, hazards like fallen trees, loose/falling rock, undefined trails, and hidden stump holes exist. Click more to learn about burned area safety.

title: Natchez Visitor Center Closed
description: The Natchez Visitor Center is closed for the renovation of the public lobby area. For those seeking visitor information, we direct you to VisitNatchez at the Depot on Boundary Street. Or their website, VisitNatchez.org. We apologize for any inconvenience.

title: Closure: Portion of the Awatixa Trail
description: The river bank section of trail below the Sakakawea Village and continuing upriver to the parking access with is currently closed due to ongoing erosion and project work.

title: Backcountry Camping Closed
description: Backcountry camping at the park is closed. There is no established opening date at this time.

title: Use Caution in and around Pedersen Lagoon
description: On August 7, 2024, a landslide triggered tsunami washed over portions of Pedersen Lagoon near Aialik Bay (59.8842N, -149.7309W). We recommend caution for those visiting the area in and around Pedersen Lagoon. Click more for additional information.

title: Temporary Restrooms Open while Hospital Street Restroom Building is Closed
description: A temporary restroom trailer has been installed in the inner courtyard of the Guinea Company Warehouse. The public restrooms on Hospital Street are closed.

title: Vehicle entrance reservation not needed
description: Although an entrance pass is required to enter Yellowstone National Park, vehicle reservations are not needed. You are encouraged to purchase an entrance pass before arriving, but you may also purchase passes at any entrance station upon arrival.

title: Lower Tyler Bend River Access Closed for Renovation Project
description: Beginning Monday, August 12th, the Lower Tyler Bend River Access will be closed to facilitate the renovation process. The Upper Access will remain open. The Tyler Bend Campground will also remain open.

title: New Parking Lot Installation
description: Please excuse our dust as a new parking lot is being installed and will affect parking and entrance areas. Please refer to directional signs and information posted. Also remember to drive slowly in construction areas. We are sorry for the inconvenience.

title: Government Wash closure to vehicle access and overnight camping
description: Government Wash Road and 8.0 Mile Road will be blocked, and motor vehicle access and overnight camping in the area will be prohibited. Hiking, biking, and shoreline access by boat for recreation within 100 feet of the shoreline will remain available.

title: Bartlett Park Restrooms Closed
description: The restrooms at Bartlett Park are closed until further notice due to damage from a large fallen tree.

title: Centennial Trailhead Parking
description: Reminder: Overnight parking without a camping permit is prohibited. Permits are not issued specifically for parking. Shuttles are available in the Black Hills for through hikers on the Centennial Trail.

title: Rabies Alert
description: Please do not approach wild animals or allow wild animals to approach you. If you observe sick or suspicious animals, please notify Dispatch at 866-677-6677. For more information visit the Maryland Department of Health rabies page.

title: Interdune Boardwalk Closed
description: Due to the active safety corridor, the Interdune Boardwalk is closed. Please visit the park visitor center to learn about other options during your visit.

title: Dunes Drive Safety Corridor
description: Dunes Drive is open. A safety corridor is in effect between mile marker 3 and 5.5 along Dunes Drive. Visitors may drive but not stop or exit their vehicle in this area.

title: Impassable Bridge Near Big Spring Brook Hut
description: There is an impassable collapsed bridge near Big Spring Brook Hut located at the north section of the monument (46.0333633333, -68.7807583333). This area is impassable by foot traffic and bike.

title: Ranger-led Program Schedule Subject to Change
description: Contact the Visitor Center at 505-757-7241 to confirm tour and ranger-led program availability.

title: Overlook Parking Lot Unavailable After Dark
description: The park parking lot at 72 McBride Extension is open from dawn to dusk every day. Any vehicles left in the parking lot after dusk (i.e. sunset) are subject to towing at owner's expense.

title: Always check signs on closed road gates before recreating; roads closed to all use if work underway.
description: Closed roads may be open to non-motorized vehicles like bicycles. CHECK SIGNS on closed road gates before proceeding. During snow plowing operations or when otherwise posted, park roads are closed to all use, including hiking, bicycling, skiing, etc.

title: Major Rehabilitation on the North Parkway
description: The rehabilitation work on the North Parkway may result in impacts to travel. Click the link to sign up for updates on the project.

title: New Food Storage Guidelines to Reduce Human - Wildlife Interactions
description: In response to wolves accessing human food and garbage in and around Rock Harbor and campgrounds located on the east end of the island, new food storage guidelines to ensure the safety of visitors and wildlife are in effect.

title: Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway continues with additional Parkway closures
description: Beginning Tuesday, April 9, 2024, construction will close the Colonial Parkway to all travel in either direction between Yorktown and VA Route 199. Follow all detour signs. See additional closure information in the link below.

title: Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway continues with additional Parkway closures
description: Beginning Tuesday, April 9, 2024, construction will close the Colonial Parkway to all travel in either direction between Yorktown and VA Route 199. Follow all detour signs. See additional closure information in the link below.

title: Selma Interpretive Center Closed for Major Construction
description: The Selma Interpretive Center and bookstore will remain closed to the public until the project’s completion, which is expected by fall 2026. The Lowndes and Montgomery Interpretive Centers are open.

title: Off Road Vehicle Inspections UPDATE: 5/27/24
description: Beginning 5/27 ORV renewals & new permits will be issued at the Nathanial P. Reed Visitor Center Friday-Monday, 9am-1:30pm. No permits will be issued Tuesday-Thursday. Permits will be issued first-come first-served. Visit our ORV page for more information

title: Park Passes
description: Park passes, including: America the Beautiful, Veteran, Lifetime, etc., are UNAVAILABLE for purchase/pickup within Big Cypress. Shark Valley Visitor Center (Everglades) is the closest location to Big Cypress for purchase.

title: Bear Activity
description: Increased bear activity along the Namekagon river, ensure food and scented items are stored properly.

title: Looking for a Grand Canyon view? A warning about mobile devices and map/navigation apps
description: Map apps may direct you to Parashant if you search for directions to "Grand Canyon" due the canyon's name in both the national park and monument names. The national park has paved roads and services. Parashant has no services and rugged/remote conditions.

title: Canine distemper is believed to be present in the park.
description: Contact with saliva from wild animals can transmit distemper to pets, including from but not limited to water bowls, food bowls, trash etc. Distemper is not a threat to humans but can be deadly to pets. Ensure your pets are vaccinated or keep them home.

title: Hovenweep has gone cashless
description: The park now accepts only mobile or electronic payments for entrance & camping fees. You can reserve campsites and buy entrance passes on Recreation.gov, or only use debit/credit cards to pay in person.

title: Natural Bridges has gone cashless
description: The park now accepts only mobile or electronic payments for entrance & camping fees. You can reserve campsites and buy entrance passes on Recreation.gov, or only use debit/credit cards to pay in person.

title: Sick Birds and Wildlife, H5N1
description: Be cautious around sea lions, and dead or sick birds. If you get “bombed” by a bird, wash with soap and water immediately, monitor for signs of illness, and call your doctor. Report beached, sick or distressed wildlife to Wildlife Mortality Reporting.

title: Bear Alert
description: Black bears inhabit many of the Apostle Islands. Follow safety guidelines: store food and scented items properly, hike in groups, stay attentive, and make noises if you encounter a bear in a visitor area.

title: Transponder Sales Are Not Currently Available
description: Due to technical issues, transponder sales are not currently available. We apologize for any inconvenience.

title: Partial Closures of Calumet Bike Trail
description: Due to recent re-construction efforts, partial closures of the Calumet Bike Trail will be in effect through this fall and sometime next year. Please use caution if riding on the trail (see below) and off the trail (because of the closures).

title: Federal Public Lands Closed to All Sheep Hunting in Portions of Units 20E/25C for 2024/2025 Seasons
description: The Federal Subsistence Board issued a closure to all hunting of sheep on lands south of the Yukon River within Yukon-Charley Rivers National Preserve due to a major decline in sheep abundance.

title: Private Inholdings: Sand & Rocky Islands
description: There are privately occupied residences and docks on the southeast corner of Sand Island, as well as just north of Group Site A on Rocky Island. These areas are closed to the public. Please respect their privacy and do not trespass in these locations.

title: Canyon from Toe of Exit Glacier to the Outwash Plain
description: The canyon from the toe of Exit Glacier to where Exit Creek opens into the Outwash Plain is susceptible to sudden outburst flood events. These events produce sudden surges of water, ice and rock. The canyon is dangerous and travel is not recommended.

title: Toe of Exit Glacier, Ice Fall Hazard Zone
description: An ice fall hazard zone has been identified at the toe and sides of Exit Glacier, due to tall blocks and slabs of ice. For your safety, entry into this zone is prohibited. Please do not continue past ice fall hazard signs and see photo for more details.

title: Overlook Park Parking Lot - Vehicles Must Be Parked in a Designated Spot
description: Parking is extremely limited on weekends & event days. Overflow parking is available at the Paterson Museum, located at 2 Market Street. On weekends only, additional parking is available at the lot across from the Museum.

title: Mansion ADA Lift is currently not functional awaiting a replacement
description: Mansion ADA Lift is currently not functional awaiting a replacement, physical accessibility to the mansion will be limited to those with the ability to climb 3-4 steps into the first floor. We apologize for any inconvenience.

title: Jacob Riis Park Access Restrictions
description: Due to extremely hazardous conditions Gateway National Recreation Area has restricted access to sections of Jacob Riis Park. Erosion has created unsafe conditions from Bays 1-5, and portions of the eastern beach are closed.

title: Pu'ukoholā Heiau NHS Visitor Center and Museum is Open
description: Pu'ukoholā Heiau National Historic Site visitor center is open as of Saturday, May 25, 2024. Some areas in the park remain closed due to flood damage.

title: Main Street Walpack Bridge Closed Until Further Notice
description: Main Street in Walpack Center is closed at the Flatbrook Bridge due to structural damage to the bridge.

title: Limited Restroom Availability
description: Restrooms are available at the Independence Visitor Center at 6th & Market Streets and the Benjamin Franklin Museum (museum entrance requires a fee) in Franklin Court between Market and Chestnut Streets and 3rd and 4th Streets.

title: Click on "caution" alerts below for important details on accessing the park
description: Tamiami Trail and State Road 9336 both have ongoing construction which may cause minor delays. If you have a scheduled tour, please plan accordingly.

title: Gulf Coast canoe/kayak launch and visitor center closed during construction
description: Alternate launch sites for backcountry access include the Rod & Gun Club, Outdoor Resorts of Chokoloskee, and Chokoloskee Island Park and Marina. Fees at these sites vary. Call the park information line at 305-242-7700 for more information.

title: Park contact stations (visitor centers and ranger stations) closed in winter October thru April.
description: The national park and preserve public lands are open year-round, with limited access in winter. Visitor centers are open in summer but closed in Fall-Winter-Spring. Call (907) 822-7250 or email wrst_info@nps.gov for park information.

title: Closure of Pulltite Cabin: Effective 07/19/23 until further notice
description: Around the Pulltite Cabin, a 100’ perimeter extending in all directions has been closed to the public. Closure of the area is deemed necessary as a large tree has fallen on the structure, causing damage.

title: The Visitor Center, Picnic Area, Burial Ground, and Potomac River Beach Closed Mondays and Tuesdays
description: The Memorial Area is open daily from 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. The Visitor Center, Picnic Area, Washington Family Burial Ground, and Potomac River Beach are closed on Mondays and Tuesdays.

title: National Cemetery Closed to Vehicles; Open to Pedestrians
description: Due to weather related incidents, Vicksburg National Cemetery is closed to vehicular traffic, however it is open to pedestrians. Visitor can park in the adjacent USS Cairo parking lot and walk into the cemetery.

title: Visitor Center Closure
description: The Bering Land Bridge Visitor Center is closed for renovations. It is expected to reopen in late summer of 2025. Staff are still available and can be reached by phone or email. Please reach out through the contact us page with any questions.

title: Bauvais-Amoureux House and Grounds Closed
description: The Bauvais-Amoureux House and grounds are currently closed for a roofing project.

title: Wupatki VC Phone Outages
description: The main phone line for the visitor center experiences occasional outages. Please email FLAG_Information@nps.gov if you have trouble getting through on the main number.

title: Trail and Parking Area Re-Opened - Mt. Alava Trail
description: Mt. Alava trail and parking area are now open to the public. Access to the summit from the Alava Trailhead is strictly prohibited due to serious risks. Death or serious injury can occur. Mt. Alava summit remains accessible from the Old Vatia trail.

title: Items Worn or Used in Other Caves Not Allowed
description: A disease known as White-Nose Syndrome is killing bats in North America. To prevent it from spreading to our bats, do not wear shoes, clothing, or bring any gear into any cave at Carlsbad Caverns National Park that were in another cave.

title: Timed Entry Ticket Required to Enter Carlsbad Cavern
description: Reservations are highly recommended and can be purchased by clicking "more" or calling 877-444-6777. Reservations only select the entry time. Upon arrival at the visitor center, an entrance pass must be purchased.

title: 8 Miles of Unpaved Road to Reach Park
description: In order to reach the Sand Creek Massacre NHS, you must travel on at least 8 miles of unpaved roads. We are not able to guarantee road conditions of county roads 54 or W after spring storms.

title: Birth Home Temporarily Closed For Repairs
description: The birth home of Martin Luther King, Jr. is temporarily closed for repairs. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause. All other buildings at the Martin Luther King, Jr. National Historical Park remain open during regular park operating hours.

title: Hiking in Gold Mine Tract
description: Visitors are restricted to the designated trails within the Gold Mine Tract in the Great Falls area. This location is generally defined as that area bordered by MacArthur Boulevard and Berma Road and depicted on the Great Falls Maryland Hiking Map.

title: Manzanar Visitor Center Hours
description: The visitor center at Manzanar National Historic Site is open four days a week, Friday through Monday, 9AM to 4:30PM. The visitor center will be closed Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays. Block 14 and the grounds remain open daily.

title: Weekend Guided Tours Availability
description: Please visit the Guided Tours of the Taft Family Home page to review the tour times available for visitors on weekend day visits.

title: No Visitor Center
description: Currently, there is no visitor center for Amache National Historic Site. There is a museum in the town of Granada that is operated by Amache Preservation Society. Learn more at amache.org

title: BOARDWALK CLOSED along the River Trail
description: Due to structural issues, the boardwalk along the river trail is closed until further notice. Access to the Ocmulgee Heritage Trail and river is not available due to this closure. This closure does not affect access to any of the mound sites.

title: Inaccurate Third-Party Apps
description: Some third-party hiking apps are providing inaccurate trail and safety information to users. Please use the official NPS app for accurate information.

title: Harbor Seal Pupping Season Closures are in effect from March 1 through June 30.
description: From March 1 through June 30, the park implements closures of Drakes Estero, Double Point, & the western end of Limantour Spit to protect harbor seals during the pupping season. Please avoid disturbing seals to ensure a successful pupping season.

title: River Ferry at Akers (on State Highway K) CLOSED until further notice
description: The Akers Ferry on State Highway K will not be in service until further notice.

title: Condition of Turkey Creek Trail
description: Turkey Creek Trail, located near the Harbor Bay Campground Area, is currently underwater in some parts. We are working on this issue. An alternative hiking trail would be Harbor Bay Trail.

title: Moores Creek Visitor Center Open Tuesday-Saturday and Park Grounds Open Seven Days Per Week
description: The Moores Creek Visitor Center/Bookstore is open Tuesday to Saturday from 9 am until 5 pm. Park grounds are open seven days per week from 9 am until 5 pm.

title: George Rogers Clark NHP in the Eastern Time Zone
description: George Rogers Clark National Historical Park is located in the Eastern Time Zone. The park is open 9:00 am until 5:00 pm (Eastern time). The memorial closes 15 minutes before the visitor center.

title: South Woolum Road Closed, Alternate Route Available
description: In the interest of safety, the South Woolum Road has been closed. The Woolum launch and campground remain open.

title: Temporary Closure on Santa Rosa Island
description: The beaches and dunes of China Camp and Cluster Point, and area in-between, are temporarily closed to all visitor access for the protection of sensitive resources. Travel is allowed on marked paths.

title: Carter G. Woodson Home NHS temporarily closed.
description: Carter G. Woodson Home National Historic Site is temporarily closed due to a full renovation project. Please continue to visit the website for future updates.

title: Bryce Canyon is Open - No Reservations Required to Enter
description: No reservations are required to enter Bryce Canyon National Park at any time of year. Simply pay your park entrance fee or present your America the Beautiful pass upon arrival.

title: Change to Summer Operating Hours
description: ***Please Be Aware*** The park will NOT be changing days of operation. The park will be open Tuesday-Saturday through the summer and winter seasons.

title: New Screening Facility at The Battery
description: The location of the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island security screening facility and ferry service has moved to a new temporary location next to The View restaurant in The Battery, NYC.

title: Temporary Closure of Eglington Preserve and Grand Teton
description: The Eglington Preserve along with the east end of Grand Teton is closed to visitor access through 2024 until construction activities at the Villages of Tule Springs is complete.

title: Park Store is Cash Only
description: Currently our cash and debit card reader in our park store is not working. We are only able to accept cash. We apologize for the inconvenience.

title: Camping and Docking at Boca Chita and Elliott Keys
description: Docking at Boca Chita and Elliott Keys: $25.00 Friday - Monday and Federal Holidays Camping at Boca Chita and Elliott Keys: $35.00 per night. Payments must be made on site using the recreation.gov phone app.

title: Construction Closures and Delays
description: Expect closures and delays at the summit of Kīlauea due to a two-year construction project to repair or remove damaged buildings and infrastructure.

title: Williams Ranch Road Closed
description: The Williams Ranch Road is currently impassable and closed to public access due to unsafe conditions.

title: Only Left Side of Diablo East and Rough Canyon Boat Ramps Are Open - Rest Are Closed
description: Due to low water levels, only the left side of Diablo East and Rough Canyon boat ramps are open. Please use caution with Spur 406 and Spur 454 launches, as the water may be too shallow to launch most boats. To see a list of open ramps, click on "more."

title: Secure trash and food
description: Pack it in, pack it out! There are no trash services in or around the monument. All food & trash must be secured inside a vehicle or hard sided containers. Ravens routinely open zipped bags & tear into trash bags left outside or in the bed of a truck.

title: Ticket Required to Hike Old Rag
description: March 1 - November 30 those wishing to hike Old Rag are required to obtain a day-use ticket before arriving.

title: Seasonal Closures In Effect
description: Seasonal closures are in effect to protect nesting birds of prey on cliffs and rock formations in the park. Please refer to closure lists in park brochures and on the raptor advisory page for more information.

title: Winter storms and trail damage
description: With winter wind storms coming and going, tree and trail damage will be fixed as weather and staffing allows. If there is a tree down or trail damage please report it to the visitor center with exact location of the damage.

title: Martinez Adobe
description: The Martinez Adobe, located on the western edge of John Muir’s historic orchard, is currently closed due to structural damage. It is unknown when the public will be able to enter the structure. The Muir/Strentzel mansion remains open to visitors.

title: No Recreational Vehicle (RV) Parking
description: Our parking lot cannot accommodate RVs or trailers. Please call the visitor center for options as we have a nearby lot for trailers to detach and are happy to help visitors in RVs plan their way to the park. RVs should NOT pull into the parking lot.

title: Texas White House Complex Closure
description: On January 2, 2024 the Texas White House Complex closed so the construction phase of the Texas White House rehabilitation can begin. The LBJ Ranch driving tour remains open. Visitors can still see the school, cemetery, birthplace and showbarn.

title: Visitor Center Phones Down
description: Phones at the Lowndes and Selma Interpretive Centers are currently down. Please call the Montgomery Interpretive Center at (334)293-0597 for questions or to make a reservation for a group visit.

title: Park Closures
description: From time to time the missile range that surrounds the park performs military testing that may require the closure of the park or Highway 70. Please plan your visit around upcoming military tests.

title: Arizona Off-Highway Vehicle (OHV) Requirements for Residents and Non-residents.
description: Off-highway vehicles (OHVs) are required by law to display a valid OHV decal to operate on public and state trust lands in Arizona. This includes “street legal” vehicles that meet these two requirements.

title: Florissant Fossil Beds has moved to cashless fee collection
description: Entrance fees and pass purchases must be made with a credit/debit card or payment app on a mobile device. Electronic payment reduces transaction times, saves money, and improves accountability.

title: Lincoln Memorial elevator out of order (Dec. 29)
description: The elevator from the ground level to the chamber at the Lincoln Memorial is out of order due to electrical issues. We apologize for any inconvenience.

title: Lower Crypt Access Subject to Safe Conditions
description: Access to the lower crypt area of the Mausoleum is subject to closure during wet and or low light conditions in the late afternoon. The main floor and the two reliquary rooms remain open during these conditions.

title: Scenic Drive Closed
description: The Scenic Drive is closed for the winter season. The visitor center is accessible and open Mondays-Saturdays 8-4:30, excluding holidays.

title: Route 7 from Sawmill, AZ is NOT recommended
description: Entering the park from the east at Sawmill, AZ on Route 7 is not recommended. Part of this route is UNPAVED and UNMAINTAINED. Please stay on paved roads, such as Indian Route 64 from Tsaile, AZ and Highway 191/Route 7 from Chinle, AZ.

title: Road construction on approach to park's Homestead entrance
description: Roadwork is underway along State Road 9336 leading to the Homestead entrance of the park, approaching the Ernest F. Coe Visitor Center. Drivers may experience short delays and should watch for personnel, construction equipment, and slowdowns.

title: Hawk Creek Lane Restriction at Lake Roosevelt National Recreation Area
description: Due to undercutting action of Hawk Creek on the access road between the Hawk Creek campground and boat launch, the road will be reduced to one lane until further notice. Use caution while on this road.

title: Extended Fish Cleaning Station Closure
description: Park fish cleaning stations will remain closed while the NPS researches and tests better alternatives. This closure includes the restroom facility located at the Fort Spokane boat launch.

title: Uber, Lyft, and Other "Taxi" Services
description: Bandelier is in a remote location, with cell service in the canyon limited to Verizon 4G only. Services like Uber and Lyft will bring you here, but there may be no way to contact a ride out. Please plan your pickup before being dropped off at Bandelier.

title: The Use of GPS is NOT Recommended
description: Numerous visitors have been routed to remote trailheads and out-of-the-way roads trying to use GPS to reach the main park area or shuttle stop.

title: Marsh-Billings-Rockefeller National Historical Park is Cashless
description: Tours may be purchased online (recreation.gov) or in person with a credit or debit card only. Cash transactions are not available at the park.

title: West and East Border Roads closed for public safety
description: The border roads remain closed (the dirt roads directly along the border and all crossover roads leading from South Puerto Blanco Drive to the border) to all public vehicle and pedestrian traffic for public safety. South Puerto Blanco Drive remains open.

title: Gachado Line Camp open. Southeast border road and access roads closed
description: El Camino De Dos Republicas remains open from SR85 to Gachado Line Camp. Dos Lomitas is not accessible. The southeast border road from Lukeville Port of Entry eastward to the Santa Rosa Mountains is closed to public vehicle and pedestrian traffic.

title: Weeping Rock Shuttle Bus Stop, Parking Area, and Trail Closed
description: Due to rockfall, the area near Weeping Rock is temporarily closed. Park scientists and maintenance staff are monitoring the area.

title: CCC Camp Picnic Pavilions Closed
description: The pavilions in the CCC Camp Picnic Area are closed for the immediate future for restoration work.

title: Planning Ahead for Transportation
description: If being dropped off at the park, please ensure you will have a return ride. Taxis and rideshares do not often come out to Congaree, and the bus may be unavailable. Please plan ahead.

title: Smith Public Use Cabin Closure
description: The Superintendent issued a closure of the Smith/40-Mile Public Use Cabin due to being unsafe for public occupancy as a result of structural damage caused by the 2023 Yukon River break-up and flooding.

title: Ride Share Services
description: Convoy Point grounds, Jetty Trail, kayak launch, and picnic area open at 7 a.m. and close at 5:30 p.m. If you are using a ride share service for transportation to and from the park, ensure ride share services can be onsite before closing time.

title: All vehicles are required to carry tire chains Nov 1 - May 1 when traveling in the park.
description: All vehicles, including 4WD and AWD vehicles, must carry tire chains in the park during the winter season (November 1 - May 1) and be prepared to use them when tire chain requirements are posted.

title: Pozo Nuevo Road to Bates Well Ranch High Clearance, 4-Wheel Drive Only
description: High Clearance, 4-wheel drive is required from where Pozo Nuevo Road begins along South Puerto Blanch Drive to Bates Well Ranch area. The road is washed out in areas. Bates Well Ranch is still accessible from the north on Darby Well Road.

title: Be aware of changing beach conditions
description: Beach conditions are changing frequently. Check current tide charts and weather forecasts before traveling on the beach.

title: Jefferson Memorial elevator
description: The elevator from the ground level to the chamber of the Jefferson Memorial may be intermittently out of order. Visitors can take steps, but if you require an elevator for a successful visit, please call this number for current status: 202-426-6841.

title: Vehicle Break-in and Theft Warning
description: Car break-ins in Cuyahoga Valley have tripled since 2022, resulting in theft of personal items like credit cards. Do not leave valuables in your car. As a last resort, lock items in your trunk before arriving. Thieves target parking lots regularly.

title: Road Open To: Mile 13 (Mountain Vista)
description: The Denali Park Road is open to Mile 13, Mountain Vista. Wintry conditions beyond that point prevent vehicle travel, though pedestrian travel is permitted.

title: Tonto National Monument has moved to cashless fee collection
description: Tonto National Monument accepts only electronic card payments for entrance fees. Electronic payment reduces transaction times, saves money, and improves accountability.

title: Spring Creek (Queens) Closed to the Public
description: Spring Creek is closed to the public at this time. The NPS is conducting field investigations as part of a Remedial Investigation at the site. Spring Creek is located in Queens, NYC.

title: Dead Horse Bay (Brooklyn) Remains Closed to the Public
description: The entire southern area of Dead Horse Bay, including Glass Bottle Beach, is closed to the public. Crews are working in these areas using heavy brush clearing equipment and performing radiation surveys. Dead Horse Bay is located in Brooklyn, NYC.

title: Melrose Mansion Guided Tours
description: Reservations for guided tours of the mansion must be made on Recreation.gov. The tour is $11.00 and are at 9, 10, 11, 2, 3, and 4; masks are optional. The estate is open daily from 8:30 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. The grounds and outbuildings are free.

title: William Johnson House Reopens!
description: The first floor exhibit hall of the William Johnson House re-opened to the public on Sept. 1. The second floor family living quarters remain closed at this time.

title: All Tickets are First-Come, First Served; We Cannot Take Reservations
description: All tickets to the Truman Home and the Truman Farm Home are first-come, first-served. At this time, we are unable to take any reservations for groups. No tickets are issued at the Truman Home itself...all tickets issued at the visitor center.

title: Potomac Heritage National Scenic Trail Closure along George Washington Memorial Parkway
description: There is a temporary closure of the Potomac Heritage National Scenic Trail crossing underneath Glebe Road Bridge due to construction along the George Washington Memorial Parkway. This work is a subsect of the North Parkway rehabilitation.

title: Credit/Debit Card Only to pay entrance fees
description: Capulin Volcano only accepts credit/debit cards for entrance fees. Our cooperating association Park Store accepts cash, credit/debit cards, and checks. There are limited cash only entrance passes available through our cooperating association Park Store.

title: Navigation Warning
description: Some navigation systems on devices misdirect visitors driving to Wilson’s Creek National Battlefield. Please note that the entrance to the park is at the visitor center located near the Southeast intersection of Hwy ZZ and FR 182.

title: 4-wheel drive recommended for beach driving
description: 4-wheel drive is recommended if driving on North and South Beach.

title: Hawai'i Wildfires
description: NPS.gov information page set up for wildfires in Hawai'i.

title: Drive Cautiously - Endangered Birds on Roadway
description: Nēnē (Hawaiian geese) and ʻuaʻu (Hawaiian petrel) are nesting in the park and may land on or frequent park roads, parking lots, and road leading up to the park. Drivers are reminded to drive at the posted speed limits and exercise caution.

title: Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park
description: You can help prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots. Before leaving your car to catch the ferry: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.

title: Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park
description: You can prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots and scenic overlooks. Before leaving your car for even a short period of time: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.

title: Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park
description: You can prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots and scenic overlooks. Before leaving your car for even a short period of time: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.

title: Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park
description: You can prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots and scenic overlooks. Before leaving your car for even a short period of time: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.

title: Limited Cell Phone Coverage
description: Cell phone voice and data coverage is very limited in the park and surrounding area.

title: Portions of Braddock Road Trail Closed
description: Portions of the Braddock Road Trail at the Indian Run bridge are closed until a new foot bridge is constructed.

title: Fire Closures - Trail, Area, and Camp Closures
description: For closures due to fire activity visit the Fire Closures page, including trail, area, and camp closures for current and post fire conditions.

title: Rideshare services should be used with caution if visiting the Tucson Mountain District
description: Rideshare services will drop visitors off at the park, but usually will not pick them back up. To avoid being stranded in the park, coordinate two-way trips before using rideshares to visit the West side. No major trails start at the visitor center.

title: Wildlife Viewing Guidelines
description: San Juan Island National Historical Park provides habitat for many species of animals. When you visit the park, you are visiting their home. Do not approach any wildlife within 75 ft/23 m (two school bus lengths).

title: Yellow Jacket (Vespula) Wasp Activity
description: Be aware of aggressive ground-nesting vespula wasps. When threatened, leave the area. If stung and you begin to experience serious symptoms or allergic reactions, call 911.

title: Partial Trail Closure at Portage Lakefront and Riverwalk
description: Closed portion of Portage Lakefront and Riverwalk Trail along Burns Waterway due to unsafe conditions from erosional damage. This trail portion will remain closed while funding is sought for repair work. Pier access remains open on either side of closure.

title: A Short Walk is Required to Reach the Fort
description: A 1/4 mile (1,275 feet) walk on a paved trail from the parking area is required to reach the gate of the fort. At the end of your visit, you'll return to your vehicle along the same path.

title: Wilderness Permits Now Only Available Online
description: Wilderness permits for backcountry camping can no longer be obtained in person or by mail. Wilderness permits are only available online through Recreation.gov. Permits can be reserved up to a maximum of 90 days prior to the start date.

title: South Unit Road from the Old East Entrance station mile near marker 22 to mile marker 28
description: Due to major road repair work, the former scenic loop between the Old East Entrance Station (near mile marker 22) and mile marker 28 is closed to all traffic, including pedestrian, and bicycle access.

title: Spring Creek Landing Closed to Vehicle-Assisted Launches
description: The Spring Creek Landing has been closed to vehicle-assisted launches. Watercraft may still be put in and take out at this point, but must be hand carried to and from the parking area. This is to ensure the safety of visitors and avoid continued erosion.

title: See TRSite.org for the latest updates on the tour schedule.
description: See TRSite.org for the latest updates on the tour schedule.

title: Kalawao County Restrictions
description: Access to the park, including Kalawao County, the Kalaupapa Trail, the settlement, and Waikolu Valley, is restricted to residents and visitors with approved permits issued by Hawaii State Department of Health. Violations will result in arrest/fine.

title: If You Can't Reach Us By Phone, Please Email Us
description: Please call 208-933-4105 to talk to a park ranger. However, if the phone lines are down, contact a ranger through email at hafo_information@nps.gov

title: Walking Bridge Over the Falls CLOSED
description: Due to safety concerns the footbridge crossing the Passaic River is indefinitely closed, pending replacement. To access Mary Ellen Kramer Park, foot traffic may use the Wayne Ave. Bridge & Maple St. - parking on Maple St. is limited.

title: Health and Safety
description: Masks are not required but are strongly recommended for all Museum visitors. Children under the age of 5 are not permitted on in-person building tours, but are welcome to attend a neighborhood walking tour or visit us virtually.

title: Roadwork may cause delays on US 41/Tamiami Trail
description: Current roadwork is ongoing along the park's northern boundary on US Highway 41/Tamiami Trail to raise the road for Everglades Restoration benefits. Drivers may experience up to 15-minute delays and should watch for personnel, equipment and slow downs.

title: Mount Tamalpais State Park - Trail Conditions
description: Many trails in Muir Woods connect to trails in Mount Tamalpais State Park. For up-to-date information about trail conditions within State Park boundaries, check the Mount Tamalpais State Park Info page (click more) and scroll down to Trail Updates.

title: The Steeple Building Closed
description: The Steeple Building remains closed until further notice.

title: County Line Road Closed Monday To Friday
description: County Line Road is closed during the week, from Monday through Friday. The closure will apply to all vehicular, pedestrian, and bicycle traffic. Please find an alternate route.

title: Roosevelt Campobello International Park is located in Welshpool.
description: Campobello Island is located in the province of New Brunswick, Canada. The physical address for the Visitor Centre is: 459 Route 774 Welshpool, New Brunswick, Canada E5E 1A4

title: Passaic River Trail Bridge washed out
description: Tropical Storm Ida washed out the Passaic River bridge on the Patriot's Path Trail south of Tempe Wick Road. This area is a known habitat of the endangered wood turtle, so do not wade, walk, or let your dog run in the river at this location.

title: Volcano Road Closed to RVs and Buses over 26 feet, and to all Trailers.
description: The Volcano top road is not accessible to RVs, buses, attached trailers, or any other vehicle over 26 feet in length, due to the narrowness and weight limits of Volcano Road. Trailer drop off and RV/bus parking is available at the Visitor Center.

title: Some facilities closed along the Potomac Heritage National Scenic Trail
description: Please see our partner sites to find the most up-to-date information on closures, re-routes, or conditions along the Trail.

title: Diablo Lake Boat Launch Inaccessible to Powerboats
description: Due to silt accumulation, the Diablo Lake boat launch at Colonial Creek South Campground is not usable for launching most powerboats. Expect shallow or no water at the launch ramp and the possibility of needing to carry your boat to or from the water.

title: Former Golf Course Property
description: The former golf course property in Peninsula, including a section of the Valley Trail, is closed during environmental remediation.

title: SEASONAL SAFETY MESSAGE
description: Be careful and safe while out in the canyon! Be cautious of your surroundings, don't cliff jump, don't stray off of the main trails, and don't get too close to Little River Falls or the canyon rim. These activities could result in injury or death.

title: Fort Davis NHS is a NO DRONE Zone!
description: The use of drones is prohibited at Fort Davis National Historic Site. Thank you for preserving the cultural landscape.

title: Fort Davis NHS is in the Central Time Zone
description: Fort Davis National Historic Site is located in the Central Time Zone. The park is open 8:00 am until 5:00 pm (Central Time). The Visitor Center closes at 4:30pm. The Main Gate locks at 5:00pm.

title: Toxic Cyanobacteria in the Virgin River and the streams of Zion National Park
description: Do not submerge your head in or filter drinking water from still or moving water.

title: Dogs Not allowed on ocean beaches in Jamaica Bay and Sandy Hook March 15- Sept. 15
description: Dogs are not allowed on ocean beaches at Sandy Hook between March 15 through September 15. Dogs are not allowed on the ocean beaches at Jacob Riis Park, Fort Tilden, Breezy Point Tip and at the bayside of Breezy Point between March 15 through September 15

title: Old Courthouse Closed for Renovations
description: The Old Courthouse at Gateway Arch National Park is undergoing renovations as part of the $380-million CityArchRiver project, which is the largest public-private partnership in the history of the National Park Service. It is closed to all visitors.

title: Temporary Blackland Prairie Trail Closure to Equestrians
description: Heavy rain has undermined a culvert making it unsafe for passage. Due to horse trailer parking availability, the entire section is closed to equestrians. Hikers are still able to travel from the railroad tracks to the Parkway Visitor Center.

title: Avoid area around the church & under trees in high wind conditions
description: In high wind conditions (sustained winds of 25 mph and above) visitors are advised to avoid the area around the church, with the possibility of falling clay tiles from the roof, and the cemetery, possibility of falling tree branches or limbs. Thank you.

title: Giftshop closed the last Tuesday of every month
description: The giftshop will be closed the last Tuesday of every month for inventory.

title: Special Use Permits
description: Special Use Permits are typically needed for activities that benefit a specific group. Examples include: Groups of 40 or more, trips organized by scouting groups, churches, or academic institutions, photography, weddings, and first amendment activities

title: Weather Advisory and Storm Warnings
description: The park may have delayed openings or closures in the event of severe weather. Travel may not be recommended during these times. Please check local weather forecasts. We appreciate your understanding.

title: Weather Advisory and Storm Warnings
description: The park may have delayed openings or closures in the event of severe weather. Travel may not be recommended during these times. Please check local weather forecasts. We appreciate your understanding.

title: Weather Advisory and Storm Warnings
description: The park may have delayed openings or closures in the event of severe weather. Travel may not be recommended during these times. Please check local forecasts. We appreciate your understanding.

title: Angels Landing Pilot Permit Program
description: Everyone who hikes Angels Landing needs to have a permit. Learn why you need a permit and how to get one. This requirement does not affect entering the park or riding the park shuttle (when it is running).

title: Wind Cave moves to cashless fee collection
description: Payments for cave tours, campground fees, as well as Interagency Passes at Wind Cave National Park, will be by credit/ debit cards or digital payments only. Cash and check payments will no longer be accepted.

title: For entrance fees, we accept digital passes and credit/debit cards
description: Digital passes or credit/debit cards are the ONLY method of payment at all fee collection areas. Pre-paid digital passes are available online and may be purchased in advance.

title: Be Aware of Illegal Traffic
description: Smuggling and/or illegal entry is common in this area due to the proximity of the international border. Please be aware of your surroundings at all times and do not travel alone in remote areas.

title: Katherine Fishing Pier Temporarily Closed
description: Heavy winds have broken part of the fishing pier at Katherine Landing. The park is currently ordering the replacement parts and awaiting shipping dates. The fishing pier is closed until further notice.

title: Building Closures - Historic Preservation
description: There are a few projects underway. From time to time this may require that we close certain areas or structures for the protection of our staff, visitors, and park resources. We appreciate your understanding while we perform this critical work.

title: Pacific Arch closed through February 23
description: The Pacific Arch will be closed for maintenance through Feb 23. During this time, pedestrian access to the memorial is through the Atlantic Arch or ceremonial entrance on 17th Street. The accessible entrance is via the Atlantic Arch.

title: The North Shoreline is Closed
description: The shoreline is closed permanently for resource protection and visitor safety.

title: Big Bend is a NO DRONE Zone
description: The use of drones is prohibited in Big Bend National Park. Thank you for preserving the peace and tranquility of Big Bend.

title: Casa Grande Ruins National Monument is Fee Free
description: Casa Grande Ruins National Monument no longer charges a fee to enter the monument. The annual and senior passes are no longer available for purchase, however we are still able to issue the free passes.

title: William Floyd Estate
